alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Weston (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 23 at 6:44PM MDT until June 23 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CAMPBELL AND SOUTHWESTERN WESTON COUNTIES... At 644 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 6 miles west of Rochelle, or 24 miles southeast of Wright, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Campbell and southwestern Weston Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
